title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: Besides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Binance has one.https://www.binance.com/en/nft/homeBut for other marketplaces for NFTs, there are a lot on this list[1] where you can look at different marketplaces that you like. It includes combination of ethereum, solana and other chains. So, check and see for yourself each of them maybe the one that you're looking for is there.[1] https://dappradar.com/rankings/nft/marketplaces

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: OpenSea & Binance are great option If you are wan to great list of "NFTs-Asset with at least great value for the Image". Why both of these ? as you know the verification and listed the collection to be verified still hard comparing other NFTs. Other NFT marketplace, want to list as many project they can because is good for both platform (To make a news and spread information of their project). Because of that, the DD are quite low.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. I have been using Magic eden, but mostly for SOL based NFTS. Now it also has eth, polygon and bitcoin nft support. Then there's Blur which is definitely worth a look. It's cheap to use and you get blur token airdrops for using it. They most likely aren't worth much, but free tokens are always a nice plus. I used to use Immutable Marketplace and Tokentrove a lot for trading Gods unchained cards, but i am not sure how those are doing these days.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on June 29, 2023, 08:25:38 PMOpenSea & Binance are great option If you are wan to great list of "NFTs-Asset with at least great value for the Image". Why both of these ? as you know the verification and listed the collection to be verified still hard comparing other NFTs. Other NFT marketplace, want to list as many project they can because is good for both platform (To make a news and spread information of their project). Because of that, the DD are quite low.Am more familiar with Opensea.io. it is quite popular alongside Rarible, compared to Binance, and it is the best I have seen so far. I didn't even think Binance would be successful with their NFTs. Now with current SEC issues, I wonder how soon before another better than them with NFT marketplace and good charge comes along.There's one NFTs market place I remembered stumbling upon sometime back, Roninsea.com.Although I was adviced it is suspicious, lacks proper information and contact details.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: Opensea is still the best but if you wanna find NFTs that have been supporting by exchange site and you can go visit exchange's nft market place. The exchange site like binance, kucoin even okx have been making their own NFT market place. It's not so hard to find that through search engine. Rarible is not as good as you said as the volume on it is quite small at this moment. I think that exchange site's NFT marketplace mostly used by so many transfers too. That's why it's good for you to visit that place.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Still OpenSea though, they established the NFT games so most likely everyone is going to their platform. Others say Binance but I haven't explore it that much though. I mean there could be more alternatives out there, but why look for options when we have the best right now?In any case I read that some exchanges too, like Gate.io has one. But then again, the volume might be too low for you.

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: I would like to mention Blur, because of its popularity in the NFT market recently, compared to Opensea I appreciate much more than at the present time, the problem is finding an NFT market is not. I think there are a lot of different options that are not specific to any specific audience, like most of them are good with similar features, the difference is the number of users and the transaction volume is not the point. Notably, as the NFT trend cooled down, there wasn't much hype about it.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Aside Opensea and Rarible, these are some that I know:NBA Top ShotBinanceNifty GatewaySuperRareI read some months ago when Blur NFT marketplace was created that it become the second with the highest trading volume because of low fee. Opensea even reduced their fee at that time if I remember correctly. I do not follow what is going on in NFT marketplace, to know if this has changed or not.

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: It has been mentioned several times before, but Blur is currently making waves in the industry. They're gaining significant attention due to their airdrop/token rewards program. They also offer a unique NFT marketplace experience, which resembles more of a token exchange, making it more appealing to traders.Their incentive program is generating substantial volumes right now. However, the long-term sustainability of this approach is unclear. The key question is whether they can generate enough revenue to offset the emissions of their BLUR token and prevent its value from going to zero.

comments.author: Abiky
comments.body: Quote from: jossiel on June 29, 2023, 05:59:44 PMBinance has one.https://www.binance.com/en/nft/homeBut for other marketplaces for NFTs, there are a lot on this list[1] where you can look at different marketplaces that you like. It includes combination of ethereum, solana and other chains. So, check and see for yourself each of them maybe the one that you're looking for is there.[1] https://dappradar.com/rankings/nft/marketplacesI've totally forgot about Binance. Thanks for bringing that up. The link you've provided has a comprehensive list of NFT marketplaces available across different blockchain networks. I think I've found what I was looking for. As much as I find Solana to be cheaper and faster than other chains, it's certainly full of issues (mostly network outages). That's the reason why I didn't ask for Solana-based NFT marketplaces in the first place. It's a good thing Magic Eden now supports ETH, and other popular chains. Else, it would've died with Solana already. As long as NFT marketplaces don't censor certain NFTs on-chain, there should be nothing to worry about.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Blur is a newcomer NFT marketplace that has even surpassed Opensea in volume in the last 30 days, so for now the most suitable place for you in my opinion is Blur. Apart from Blur, you can also explore X2Y2, LooksRare, SuperRare.co and Element. For a complete list, you can look for it on DappRadar, the link I embedded will show you the NFT Marketplace which also supports the Ethereum network.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Blur is new but going up in volume, I think it's became popular with the chance of an airdrop so I think the volume is being manipulated so take caution on how you will interact with them. I'm not that an expert especially when it comes to long term investment's but I think it's worth a shot for Blur to be the best when it comes to nft trading.

comments.author: evichi
comments.body: You can take a look at HOVR (https://hovr.site/) NFT market place backed by QI blockchain. It is an emerging NFT platform with real NFT use cases and low transaction fee. The blockchain relies on Proof of Work consensus mechanism and supports Web 3.0. I think HOVR is a unique NFT market worth exploring.

comments.author: Desscount
comments.body: Quote from: rhomelmabini on June 30, 2023, 06:32:13 PMQuote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Blur is new but going up in volume, I think it's became popular with the chance of an airdrop so I think the volume is being manipulated so take caution on how you will interact with them. I'm not that an expert especially when it comes to long term investment's but I think it's worth a shot for Blur to be the best when it comes to nft trading.Manipulated or not, it's better to be safe by doing your research first,the price of Blur had dropped and now it is gradually increasing,that seems like a good suggestion.

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. If you're interested in Bitcoin NFTs (Counterparty tokens -- which are pretty solid and likely to outlast the Ordinals craze), I recommend checking out their DEX & dispensers:https://xchain.io/Same thing with Dogeparty, there's a lot of sleepers (like Rare Doges) out there that have a good chance of commanding more value for collectors in years to come:https://dogeparty.xchain.io/This is a site that specifically tracks Rare Pepe sales on both Counterparty and OpenSea:https://pepe.wtf/As far as long-term investments go, I think Rare Pepes & other early Counterparty tokens (from 2014-2017) are the best bet and outline why in this thread.Finally, I also really like Monaparty tokens as they have a vibrant community of artists, plus they are dirt cheap:https://monapalette.komikikaku.com/shopshttps://monapalette.komikikaku.com/dispensers

comments.author: axxo
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 29, 2023, 05:20:47 PMBesides OpenSea and Rarible, do you know of any other NFT marketplaces that are worth exploring? I'm looking for a place where I could find quality NFTs that are worth the long-term investment. ETH-based marketplaces would be fine, as long as there nothing Solana-based. Any suggestions and/or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance. Aside from OpenSea and Rarible you can also check out Nifty Gateway because it is a user-friendly platform that allows artists to create and sell their limited edition NFT's. It is popular choice among collectors, the platform also hosts drops from well known artists and brands. Another one is AtomicMarket a marketplace that allows users to buy and sell NFT's accross multiple blockchains and it offers less fees and user friendly userface. There are many marketplaces to choose from, each with its own unique features and benefits. You can research and study if it is a good platform or not.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: evichi on July 01, 2023, 02:38:59 AMYou can take a look at HOVR (https://hovr.site/) NFT market place backed by QI blockchain. It is an emerging NFT platform with real NFT use cases and low transaction fee. The blockchain relies on Proof of Work consensus mechanism and supports Web 3.0. I think HOVR is a unique NFT market worth exploring.The OP is looking for decent NFTs to hold for long term investment, can we trust NFT Marketplace which is backed by blockchain projects that the public rarely even knows about? Maybe OP will suffer a loss if he buys NFTs there later . I know we're talking about marketplace here, but I can't believe this (rank 3,800+).

comments.author: disconnectme
comments.body: For now, it is between OpenSea and Blur, the liquidity on Blur is very deep for some NFTs, I have not checked Binance NFT marketplace and check how deep the liquidity is, but you can look into that. LookRare is another one to consider but it seems it has lost its appeal after the liquidity mining ended. I still feel the NFT market has a long way to go in term of market and liquidity because most of the trading volume for now are just for liquidity mining, I will like to see what happens to Blur after they stop the token incentives.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Binance is the next best option when it comes to NFTs and this can also allows you to enjoy some feature if you will invest with NFTs with them. The hype of NFTs might be gone for now but I’m sure their future is still bright and investing with them can also be a good idea, why consider other site if you already have the best one? Anyway Rollbit also have a market place if you are into gambling, this can benefit you as well.
